remarks: There exists a function x as in the proof of Lemma 2 in [BrosowskiDeutsh] p. 91.  Here ` D ` is used to represent ` A ` in the paper, because here ` A ` is used for the subalgebra of functions. ` E ` is used to represent ε in the paper.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)
statement:

stoweidlem51.19 $e |- ( ( ph /\ f e. A /\ g e. A ) -> ( t e. T |-> ( ( f ` t ) x. ( g ` t ) ) ) e. A ) $.
